examples: Si nana gumupu iyo-ku. (Mother helped me.)
Kao guaha si nana-mu? (Is your mother there?)
nana.notes: Common word for mother. Often used with possessive suffixes: nana-hu (my mother), nana-mu (your mother), nana-ña (his/her mother)

nanå.notes: Alternate spelling of nana with diacritics

examples: Bunitu i guma'-hu. (My house is beautiful.)
Mañåga para i guma'. (Go to the house.)
Kao maolek i guma'-mu? (Is your house good?)
guma'.notes: Most common word for 'house' in Chamorro. Often used with possessive suffixes: guma'-hu (my house), guma'-mu (your house), guma'-ña (his/her house)

house.definition: guma' (noun). The most common Chamorro word for house, home, or building.
house.notes: English→Chamorro: house = guma' (preferred over håsienda/hasienda which is Spanish loanword)

unu.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'one' in counting

hugua.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'two' in counting

tulu.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'three' in counting

fatfat.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'four' in counting

lima.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'five' in counting

gunum.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'six' in counting

fiti.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'seven' in counting

guålu.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'eight' in counting

sigua.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'nine' in counting

månot.notes: Native Chamorro word for 'ten' in counting
